intro: Liabum diehlii, commonly known as the Diehl's liabum, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
